It is a plus (I am disabled) that you can enter this Savannah River spot from Bay Street, rather than having to negotiate your way down to the riverside. We were gently treated although 15 minutes early for our reservation. Waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu, preparation, and was very efficient. I had their Angus burger and my wife had the arugula and greens salad with grilled shrimp. Both dishes prepared expertly (to include a medium rare burger, shows confidence in their meat) and delicious. Lovely old Savannah building with windows looking out over the river. Great location, view, food and service.

I specifically went for the crab benedict, but decided on something else. My husband and I actually "grazed",- 2 apps. shared shrimp and grits (which was split in the kitchen) and the wonderful carrot cake!

It has gotten to the point that this is my favorite restaurant. Love Muss and Turner and Pasta da Pulcinella, but this place has delicious, perfectly prepared pastas and pizzas, but -- IT IS AFFORDABLE! Saturday we had the fig and prosciutto pizza, and egg white pasta with sausage and brocolli rabe. Excellent - as always. Did I mention the inexpensive vodka (Ketel 1) martinis?

This is my 5th visit to Vinny's on Windward and every time it is excellent. The food choices, the wine choices, the ambience, the service - it is always fantastic. The shrimp and scallop risotto is delicious, as are the crab cakes. I highly recommend Vinny's for lunch or dinner.
We always enjoy Violette. The food is very good and consistent and the service and atmosphere is excellent.

column4: 1000 Marietta St. NW, Suite 202 Atlanta, GA  30318
column13: This restaurant is new, so granted there are things that need to be worked on with the service. The proportions were good, and the food was great. There was a nice fire place where you could sit and have a cocktail. The dining room was full when we got there which is good considering from reading past reviews, people said it was somewhat empty. I was a little confused because we were greeted by one server who took our app order and shortly after we were greeted by another server who also offered tot take our order. Our server forgot to put in our appetizer order and we ended up getting it after our entrees. However they comped it as well as our drinks. I would consider returning once they get the service kinks out.

This restaurant is very convenient to many downtown Atlanta hotels. Thus, a great spot for a casual business dinner. Several colleagues and myself dined around seven thirtyon a week night. The service started soon enough. We ordered drinks and appetizers. No first course, just entrees--steaks. We knew we were in trouble when we were brought a second round of a favorite starter. Almost fifty minutes later, dinner arrived. A manager did stop by at one point to tell us that the food was a little slow.We were also given a complimentary dessert. I would certainly go back realizing that service could be an issue.
Well kept secret that needs a full bar. Food plentiful and very tasty, coconut soup too sweet for my taste but my date loved it. Service was swift and professional.
Wonderful food! Wonderful staff! Lovely restaurant!
The food and service were the best we have ever had anywhere, anytime! It was a most pleasurable experience.

Food is good, and thought service was good until I later checked the bill and found out he charged us $10 for Legendario which no one ordered nor received. Unfortunately we didn't scrutinize the bill before paying. Don't make our mistake!!
I love Zen on Ten its one of my favorite spots.

17 North had been one of our favorites- for ourselves and to bring out of town guests.Not so anymore.They have a lot or work to do to get back to high quality food, service and overall dining experience.

column4: 66 Columbus Street Culinary Institute of Charleston Charleston, SC  29403
column13: The fried oyster appetizer was delicious. Would love it if it was also offered as an entree

Wanted to charge sharing fee for salad. No other restaurant we've eaten at in Charleston has done that. Beef bourgonoin was awful, tough and chewy. Was taken off check. But with all the great restaurants in the city, would not go back.

As always this is an execellent place to have a nice quiet and romantic meal. The food was absolutely AMAZING! Out of all the resturants in Charleston; this by far is the closest thing to true italian food that you will ever get here.

column4: 76 Queen's Folly Rd Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: Mainly went for the food as it was ranked very high on the list for the area. We knew it would be fairly expensive but we were there for my wife's birthday. Remember happy wife means happy husband. The food was excellent. We both had the specials lamb and fillet and they were cooked perfectly.
waitress would rather talk that do her job
We all had great meals, I had the best sword fish dinner ever. We have been here several times never disappointed.

column4: 5101 N Kings Highway Myrtle Beach, SC  29577
column13: Waiter was pleasant, but when presented with specific dietary needs, became a bit frazzled. Owner/chef came out to assist and calm situation. Waiter was quick to say no to dietary requests. Very awkward and uncomfortable for a bit, however, Chef/owner reversed "no" to the dietary needs and accommodated. Food was great, wine selection was great. Pricey but worth it for a special occasion or date night.

We enjoyed dining on the patio. The sushi is fresh, with many creative offerings. The rolls are very generous so you quickly forget they are a little overpriced. There are plenty of flavors, from fruity to on fire. A nice sashimi plate is available called Belly Belisimo that is worth trying for those that enjoy nice fish cuts.

column4: 9650 N Kings Hwy Myrtle Beach, SC  29572
column13: The service was good but the prime rib special was small, thin and tough. Save your money and pick another steakhouse. We followed the next day by dining at Chucks Steakhouse and that was an AMAZING meal!!

column4: 1453 Highway 17 S North Myrtle Beach, SC  29582
column13: We've been coming to Myrtle Beach for 25 years, and for some reason this was our first foray into Benny Rappa's. I had expected the food to be a bit spicier and more traditional Italian...and the portions were far too large. This is a charming restaurant, a good eatery that could be great if 1) they offered small plates 2) put out their butter more elegantly (i.e. NOT in wrapped foil patties) 3) worked on their flavours, particularly for fish dishes. We'll go back, and next time try something off-menu as offered by the chef, maybe a veal piccata? By the way the homemade Lemoncello is the best I've ever had...even in Italy!
I would highly recommend Bin 112

This is the place which will be dependable when looking for a place to eat. The menu is Italian and Beef. There is an acceptable wine list and bar with live music on weekends. Food preparation was not my style, but I see it a lot in low-country South Carolina - lots of sauces and dried spice mixtures on vegetables. The raw ingredients were excellent.
Food was excellent and the atmosphere was refreshing....not too crowded and lively. We would definitely go here on a return visit to Charleston.
Never disappointed with the service nor the food. A treasure for Columbia.
Any time we have been at Blues Boulevard we had wonderful service and great martinis.
Wine rooom great for party of 9

Our food was delicious, and our service was exceptional. We were there to have dinner as the start of a bachelorette party celebration for my sister. The chef was kind enough to send out a tasting prior to the meal and everyone raved about what they ordered. Personally, I got the caprese salad and the tapas sized scallop dish...both were amazing. Our server selected a cocktail for my sister (who is notorious for being indecisive) and she loved it.
A dining experience. Dinner was delicious, service was nice but dinner took 2 1/2 hours.
Live blues, delicious entrees, attentive but unobtrusive service, and a romantic vibe similar to the jazz clubs in Amsterdam raise this club above the rest in Greenville.

This tucked away gem behind the Exchange was the perfect spot for a quiet dinner after a day of sightseeing. We enjoyed a Caesar salad, the quail appetizer, the flounder, and the toasted berry pound cake. All were prepared perfectly and presented beautifully.The relaxing atmosphere, attentive service and great food made our evening the perfect end to a great day. Nice going, Carolinas!

We had a wonderful dinner at Carter's Kitchen ... Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and seated at our table immediately. The waitress was very informed and helpful when reviewing the menu. Tried the okra chips - YUM! My husband wanted low country cooking and his meal was wonderful.I am transiting into a vegan diet and was amazed by their vegan sausage, peppers and onions. At first I thought I had misunderstood that the meal was vegan as the texture and flavored were exactly as if I was eating meat. Even my carnivore husband thought my meal was delicious. Best vegan meal I have had anywhere to date! Service was super - would highly recommend this restaurant.
Since I was a customer of Cesca in New York This Charleston version lives up to its New York progenerator
We dined at the bar and had one of the best meals we ever had. Great

column4: Two Hudsons Road Hilton Head Island, SC  29926
column13: The service and attention was great! Thank you for making our Anniversary memorable.

I just moved here from Jacksonville and, being a foodie, I was looking forward to a whole new city with new restaurants. Everything was decent, I liked how quiet the restaurant was, but I got the feeling that our server was inexperienced and that the food and drinks we got weren't worth what I paid.

column4: 7740 N Kings Hwy Myrtle Beach, SC  29572
column13: Absolutely wonderful in every way. There may be art on the walls but the true masterpiece(s) is on the table.

column1: Conroy's at Hilton Head Marriott Resort
column4: One Hotel Circle Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: Enjoyed the food and the waiter was very fast and friendly. The White Chocolate bread pudding was great.

column4: 140A Lighthouse Lane Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: Every time we visit Hilton Head my husband and I come here for a special dinner while the grandparents watch our children. This time we brought our girls, 4 and 9, as a special treat. While we enjoyed the ambiance and our food, we were quite disappointed in the service for our kids and their food. They both ordered pasta and we thought, this being a lovely restaurant, something special would be done--chopped veggies or or herbs or or something as opposed to just pasta with some cheese. Also, our waitress never acknowledged our children. She asked us for our drink, dinner and dessert orders-- never them. We had to call her back to get them drinks. They were on their best behavior and I was surprised at the lack of service for them.

column4: 26 New Orleans Rd Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: A group of four, one of us had eaten here before. Salad was awesome. My husband's scallops were cooked to perfection. The other couple had steaks they thought were excellent. My sesame crusted seared tuna was, in my opinion, over cooked. Perhaps I had hoped seared tuna would be closer to sushi. I don't think a seared tuna should flake, which this did. Not as good as I would have liked.

column4: 3751 Robert Grissom Parkway Myrtle Beach, SC  29577
column13: an excellent option for those looking for an upscale alternative to the otherwise saturated tourist-trap restaurant market in Myrtle Beach.

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - Myrtle Beach
column4: 4640 Hwy 17th South North Myrtle Beach, SC  29582
column13: My wife ordered the prime rib special which was excellent, and I ordered a burger called the Juicy Lucy which was also excellent! Our sever was training a new person and both were very helpful, and the trainer was not over bearing. Would definitely come back again.
while i had a reservation, the table was not open. had to wait for ~20 mins. i was 10 mins late in advance of that. great food & great staff.

Excellent food and wonderful waitstaff. Very fresh ingredients in specials detailed by waiter - we ended up ordering them for entree and were not disappointed. Great location is easy to walk to from historic district hotels.
Great place good food and great service. Went there in evening and really enjoined it.

column4: 25 East Court Street, Suite 100 Greenville, SC  29601
column13: Consistent and creative. Greenville's best restaurant.

column4: One Shelter Cove Ln Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: Our first visit and certainly not our last. We dined during the first week in November on a Monday evening which proved to be a slow night during the off season for HHI. That being said, the meal from beginning to end may have been the best meal we have had on the island in over twenty plus years. Quality ingredients, entree choices which appeal to even the most finicky eater and a view which was just fantastic. My wife and I chose Mahi and Scallop entrees which were fresh and prepared perfectly. The owner was friendly and engaging. Our server started with enthusiasm but gradually faded away during the meal(my only area of concern to an otherwise great dining experience). This is truly an asset to the the dining scene on the island.
Great brunch/lunch food in nice patio setting on a beautiful early fall day. Service a little iffy in terms of timeliness.

column4: 915 Houston Northcutt Rd Mount Pleasant, SC  29464
column13: would be better if it was quieter, but the same can be said about many Charleston places

This was a great find. I would never have guessed a hotel restaurant could compete with some of the other great restaurants in Greenville. I had a perfectly cooked filet. My husband and daughter both had fish which was perfect for them. My daughter had a really unique salad with a gelled balsamic on watermelon and this frozen tomato granita. It was amazing! The atmosphere reminded me a little of Alice in wonderland but somewhat cozy at the same time.

column4: 863 Houston Northcutt Blvd Mt. Pleasant, SC  29464
column13: Great restaurant with great food. Very impressed with the Lobster Mac and Cheese and the pasta specials.
Loved, loved, loved!! Great place. Food was excellent, well presented. Great ambiance, loved the atmosphere. Good down town choice for taking brunch or lunch.

Our "girl's" supper club at here and we enjoyed it once again...it is NOT a quiet place which is fine for a crowd like ours but I can't imagine a romatic dinner for two here. The food is great and our server was too.

From the moment we were greeted at the door - the service and staff engagement was noticeable and it caused us to feel as though we were the only patrons despite being rather busy. The food was absolutely wonderful! Scollaps as tender as I have ever had, seasoned to sheer perfection. My tenderloin was fork tender and seemed to melt in my mouth. My compliments to the staff and a special thanks to Velvet for such awesome service! Your pleasant, welcoming attitude was the perfect accompaniment to such an fantastic meal!
Great food, great service and great place. Building is historic and just "fits"

Though we've been going to HH for years, we didn't even realize this restaaunt was at the Omni Hotel. Everything was wonderful, service ambience, and food! I highly reccomend people to try it even if they are not staying at the resort and/or are local residents. We are part time residents of the island and will return in the near future.
Food, ambiance, service is / has always been great. One of my favorites in Charleston. Seemed like not quite as strong as it has been and a little pricy give I can't rank it "exceptional".

column4: 550 South Main Street at RiverPlace Greenville, SC  29601
column13: Could not have been happier! Food was superb and the service even better!! Beautiful place and beautiful scenery and view.

Husk is an amazing restaurant which will leave you wanting more. There is not a bad choice on the list and if you cannot decide what to eat the staff will be more than happy to assist. This was one of my top 5 meals of all time! The parsnip soup is a must!
This restaurant is situated within 5 minutes drive from the downtown Marriott, and the inside ambiance of the eatery more than compensates for the outside appearances of a nondescript strip center.

column4: 1739 Maybank Hwy Ste V Charleston, SC  29412
column13: There were several larger groups in when we were there so it wasn't quiet, but we could still easily have conversation which was nice. Our server was friendly and helpful. The food was incredible (a rainbow sushi roll for an appetizer, I got the Shrimp BLT salad and my boyfriend got the Wild Mushroom Linguine with shrimp). The atmosphere is cozy and the decor gives a different vibe than a lot of other places around here (it was great!).

column4: 1405 Ben Sawyer Blvd Suite 103 Mt. Pleasant, SC  29464
column13: We wanted to support the new JPaulz in Mt. Pleasant but this was a poor first experience. The server had so little interest in seeing that we were having a good experience, he took away my nearly-full main course plate without even asking why I had not eaten it. The seafood chowder was good but the salmon dish I ordered was not the light, healthy dish I expected. In fact it seemed loaded with some kind of oily pasta I could not identify. It tasted Ok, I guess, but rested like a stone in my stomach. Maybe I ordered poorly but the rest of the entrees were so garlic laden and/or unhealthy, the salmon seemed the only reasonable choice. A revised menu, lighter hand in the kitchen and some minimal training for the waitstaff would go a long way.

out of the historic downtown area, but well worht finding. We live in charlestonand lana's always does a great job. it is a beautiful small neighborhood style restaurant that doesn't lack anything when it comes to food.
Had a great time... Food was unbelievable would Definately go again

We were worried at first - our table wasn't ready and it felt like they didn't want to seat us. When they did seat us it was in a different room from the rest of the dinner patrons in the room they usually use for brunch. However, it turned into a wonderful experience. Our waiter, Charles, made our dinner a VIP experience! Totally worth the wait. The food was great and Charles described everything so wonderfully that we wanted to try everything.

column4: 1212 North Kings Hwy Myrtle Beach, SC  29577
column13: This was our first trip to the Library though we've lived in Myrtle Beach for 2 years. After leaving we wondered what took us so long to try this gem. There were 4 in our party and we were all thrilled with our appetizer and main course selections. The carpaccio and beef tips were both exceptional appetizers. Our main couse choices were salmon, duck and veal. They were all prepared to perfection and I found the sauces to be delicious and prepared with a very creative flair. Our server Shannon was tremendously knowledgeable and obviously had years of fine food experience. The owner introduced himself and visited our table a few times during the evening. I highly recommend this restaurant to all those who enjoy fine food.
John and his staff really know how to treat you. Great food, Excellent Wine and the Service is awesome. Always on our list when in MB.

Coming from Philadelphia which boasts some of the best restaurants in the east coast I have high standards and Magnolia's met them all. The food was excellent I would recommend the fried green tomatoes appetizer. The decor was inviting with real southern hospitality. Our waiter was so informative and tended our every need. Hope to get to charleston again to go to Magnolia's

column4: 35 Office Park Rd Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: I took my fiance to Marley's for her birthday - it was our first visit to the restaurant and we couldn't have been more pleased! The food was excellent and priced very nicely, especially since we were able to take advantage of the early dining prices all night! We are locals and are kicking ourselves for checking out the fare earlier - we will be regulars from now on, though!!

We took out of town guests to McCrady's for dinner on their last evening in Charleston; it was a highlight of their visit. I had called ahead and asked for a specific table and was accommodated. The four course dinner was the way to go here: we all enjoyed the presentation and the delicious food. Two issues: I ordered a 2008 California cab and a 2009 was delivered to the table, without explanation. The server apologized, but the sommelier never appeared to discuss the situation.; I ordered the pork and received the lamb dish instead. The maitre d' appeared fairly quickly with my pork dish and apologized for the confusion. Overall, however, we had a great time here.
Casual, good food Excellent service Was early for reservation and they accommadated nicely
Very good location. Was a fun night. We really enjoyed the jazz band. However, they took too many long breaks. We were there for dinner, not a whole night of listening.

column4: 2930 Devine Street Suite A Columbia, SC  29205
column13: Food was good and our waiter was fanatastic.Menu was limited on the entrees.

We bring our friends here all of the time and most every time has been great. the service tends to be the problem in this restaurant....not the food. It is not consistent and we have been disappointed with our service in the past.
Great food, service and ambience, love the decor, our waitress was just lovely. really enjoyed our brunch

Over all our experience was good. My problem was ,knowing how to cook a steak to the correct temperature is cooking 101. Your chef failed on both orders, mine beinging the worse of the two. This was very dissapointing being it was my birthday. You would expect paying $28.00 per steak it would be cooked to perfection. Your servers handled it very professionally by acting concerned and offering a courtesy dessert. I would probably give the place another try being that everything else we ordered was good. Iguess Iwould stay away from the steak. Everybody deserves a second chance but two strikes and you'll be out.
The bartender, was awesome!!! Management should promote this man!

My boyfriend took me to Nantucket Seafood to celebrate my birthday, and the food was absolutely delicious and VERY fresh. We had the blue crab hush puppies for an appetizer which were very good as well as the she-crab soup. We have tried she-crab soup at too many restaurants to say, but this was the absolute BEST I've had. It was the perfect consistency, was creamy, and had enough Old Bay seasoning that I could taste it.For my entree, I chose the special white fish, mara, and it was cooked perfectly. My boyfriend had the surf and turf (lobster with filet mignon), and the lobster was delicious (I couldn't turn down a bite of lobster!). He said the filet mignon was very good as well. We will definitely visit Nantucket Seafood again!

column1: New York Prime Steakhouse - Myrtle Beach
column13: Great as always, but the background music is simply too loud.

column4: 10880 Ocean Highway No 21 Pawleys Island, SC  29585
column13: Was good but a little over- priced for the quality. Service was good, waiter was attentive until a party of 8 showed up and, evidently, more important than our party of two. The salmon neopolitan was interesting thought the fried green tomatoes were overlooked. My steak was tasty but a little on the tough side. It was very dark - a shame since the restaurant itself was quite beautiful...

The service was amazing from the time of the reservation, all the way through to getting our car from the valet. Spectacular wine list, and the waiter made some wonderful recommendations for pairings. The dry-aged NY strip was divine, much better ambiance than that other chop house, which I love!!! I am hooked - beautiful experience!!!

This is the newest restrautant to open in Columbia and it defines what good dining is all about. We were seated the moment we walked in and it wasn't long after that when a server appeared followed by a waitress. Overall, the staff was personable and efficient, the food was very good. The wine list is good but it could have more by-the-glass offerings. My only criticism is the noise level, the dining room was not designed to absorb noise and sometimes, it can be difficult to hear the person sitting next to you. Other than that, this is a top notch restaurant.

The Manager was so kind to us in modifying our reservation and placing us at a window table facing the television. We wanted to view the Alabama vs LSU football game and so appreciated his enabling us to do so.The food was fantastic- sushi phenomenal. Do not miss the desserts- especially the pot de creme and strawberry wafer. They are equal if not beyond the best we've ever eaten.

column4: 65 Skull Creek Drive Hilton Head Island, SC  29926
column13: Perfect rendition of Old South view of rieve, moss-laden oak trees and river. Go at sunset for a special view. Wide selection of credibale wines at reasonable prices. Food perfectly prepared and good selection.
Old Village Post House & Tavern never lets us down.....a terrific and friendly staff and great food. We do -- and will -- come back often!

column4: 1960 Riviera Dr Ste C Mt. Pleasant, SC  29464
column13: Love the food at Opal! Always. Consistent and involved flavors. The homemade pasta is excellent! Always love going favorite Mt Pleasant restaurant.
Great Place for anyone and Great Owner, John, and great team!

column1: The Palmtree Grill @ Embassy Suites North Charleston
column13: I visited on a quiet Sunday evening. There were only a few patrons in the restaurant, and the atmosphere was peaceful and relaxing. The service was excellent and the food was also. I had the french onion soup which was good and the fish and chips, which was excellent. I also recommend the bread pudding for dessert if you still have room. I thought the portions were plentiful, but not overwhelming. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant if you are staying or visiting the North Charleston area.
Avoid. Many other great places in Beaufort to try.
That was wonderfull, food, service were excellent.A great restaurant

This was our second visit to the Peninsula Grill during our vacation in Charleston. The food was just as excellent and the service as impeccable as our first visit. I had the Lobster and corn chowder for first course, the scallops which were cooked perfectly as my entree, and last, but certainly not least, the milk chocolate creme brulee for dessert which was as heavenly as the first time I had it. We will definitely make a return visit to the Peninsula Grill whenever our travels take us back to Charleston.
Wonderful. We stumbled on Plums when we took an unplanned detour through Beaufort.

Hey, nothing like I'd imagine...but this place was wonderful. I had the fried chicken and potatoes with carrots. For low country meals and sassy great chef inspired stuff, from start to finish...you can't even come close to losing with this place.

This is a wonderful place with lots of history of the area. Kids will enjoy going through the front where they have real items from pirate ships. The main dining room is made as the inside of a ship, complete with mast and sails!!

column4: 1011 Fording Island Rd Suite C105 Bluffton, SC  29910
column13: I hosted a meeting of seven girls on a thursday night at 630. We had the table in the back wine cellar, what a great room! The food was fabulous and the enomatic machines are a great experience. I hightly recommend the wine boutique for groups or a couples night out. The owners are great hosts!

Main entree of tile fish was outstanding with a great accompanying fine wine sauce. Table by fireplace was perfect for a romantic way to celebrate an anniversary dinner. Service both at the bar and table were impeccable. Friendly wait staff who know how to take care of their customers.

column4: 8 Archer Rd. Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: A nice find for HHI. We will return to RedFish often near our new home.
Exceptional food, good wine selection, good service.
Fine dining without the pretension. Wonderful staff and owner greeted each customer. Highly recommend!

We come here a couple of times a month. We come back because we enjoy the food, always something different to try, plus our old favorites. Great atmosphere and friendly and knowledgable service. Always pleases

column4: Hilton Hotel 924-A Senate St. Columbia, SC  29201
column13: Oscar was great in helping us have a great evening!

column4: 851 Congaree Road, Suite A Greenville, SC  29607
column13: We had a wonderful time at Ruth's Chris. The service was impeccable. Our waiter Terry was very attentive and courtesy. We choose Ruthду»s Chris due to the importance of my daughterду»s 21st birthday. She wanted to celebrate this milestone by having a delicious steak with wonderful dessert. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to celebrate any special occasion.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Myrtle Beach
column13: Having read mixed reviews and comments from friends, we did not know what to expect. A lot of what a restaurant becomes is dictated by area surroundings. Not true for our experience - other than some added noise by the hostess seating customers, the evening was quite pleasant at a table where we could actually have a conversation without speaking loudly across the table. Our server, Danielle was bubbly, enthusiastic and was very pleasant. She did a great job with the menu, allowing us ample time to decide on our order and paced the meal quite well. Food was great! Perfectly prepared and hot when served. Ample and appropriate wine list to go along with any choice of entree. A most pleasant experience and would definitely go back.

column4: 802 Bay Street, Suite C Beaufort, SC  29902
column13: We sat outside and had a beautiful waterfront veiw.My husband loved the grilled lamb he ordered and my fish was excellent.The crab bisque,salad, and warm bread were great starters.Our waiter was helpful and attentive.We will go back next time we're in Beaufort!

I brought four visiting English professors from China to lunch. This was their first real American lunch and they loved the food. The server was gracious,kind and efficient. It was a wonderful experience and they will return to China with a memorable dining experience.
Soby's has always been one of my favorite downtown resturants. Their food is consistently good.
Loved the location and the decor. Its a wonderful casual meeting place. However the noise level prevents conversation .

Our first visit. Waitress eagerly answered our questions and made recommendations. Oysters "Cajonfeller" appetizer was different and delicious. We each had one of the specials for our entree. My Mahi Mahi was light and flakey. My wife's rabbit was tender and juicy. Overall experience was excellent.
Great food you won't leave hungry!!!
Best Eggs Benedict and excellent service. Great Sunday brunch.

Only been open for 30 days but destined to becme one of Charleston's hot spots. I would classsify the food as extraorinarily well done comfort food. The menu was limited but we spread out the appetizers, main courses and the desserts among all of us and everyone's selection was fantastic. The vegetables were well cooked and tasty as were the dumplings. Seems unusual to say but you must try the chicken and dumplings.
Had a great dinner and food was delicious.
Awesome setting. The dessert and wine selection was great! We will definitely be going back.
The service was fantastic, and all nine of us loved the lunch that we ordered! Can't wait to come back again.

We were only in Newberry for one night, we found Steven W's and we really enjoyed our meal. My wife got the flounder special and I had the king salmon special - both were really great. The sides were less impressive and could definitely be improved. The dessert was an almond basket with ice cream, chocolate and caramel sauces and whipped cream - it did not disappoint. For a Friday night at 8:00 the restaurant seemed pretty quite - only 2 other tables were seated. The decor is a bit dated, but we had a great table by the window and would definitely go back.

column1: The Strip Club 104 a steak house
column13: Excellent Steaks & Wine Selection. A true "Hidden Gem" for the Greer area & Upstate...Highly Recommend!!!

column1: The Studio, An Artistic Dining Experience
column4: 20 Executive Park Road Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: Our waiter (?owner/chef) got my appetizer order wrong (salad instead of crab bisque). When advised of this error, I received an unusually stern look from him. The order was corrected, but we never saw him after that. Instead, other staff tended to our table until we were finished. Although this was in a cozy atmosphere, I did not think it was appropriate that unusual paintings (multiple) of naked women greeted you at the entrance. I understand this is also an art studio, but who would want to buy or hang a picture of a totally naked women that has a head of a buffalo with a ring in it's nose? This may appeal to some but my standards are different.
Have never had a bad meal or dessert !!! Excellent dinning experience !!
A cozy neighborhood spot. Locally owned. Everything I've gotten has been wonderful. Service is great.

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - Myrtle Beach
column13: The food and unusual menu makes this restaurant stand above all others. I recommend the lollipop chicken and macadamia encrusted goat cheese appetizers. One can not go wrong with the Sanibel Chicken and Mahi Mahi w/risuto entrees. This should be topped off with the great selection of desserts, namely the Pina Colada Cake.

column4: 160 Lighthouse Rd Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: We were in HH for vacation and were looking for new restaurants to try. The Topside has a great menu with custom preparation and very good wine selection. Will definitely be going back at the next opportunity!

column4: 33 Office Psrk Road Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: My wife and I had a fantastic meal at Trattoria Divina! Pastas were perfectly prepared, excellent salad, bread that was authentic Italian, great wine selections including a very reasonably-priced chianti. Service was friendly and efficient, with nice pacing. It's not cheap, but the prices were reasonable for Hilton Head. All in all, a great evening.

One of my favorite finds in Charleston. Impeccable service that anticipates needs without hovering or interrupting. The mushroom and wild rice salad had texture and flavor in every bite. The potato gnocchi is better than you can imagine. The wine list goes on for miles. Save up your calories all day. And, I recommend ALWAYS saving room for dessert because the passion fruit pudding with thai basil gelato float is the perfect combination.

We had a nice dinner, but our waitress was really "green". Nice, but completely in need of additional training. They had 2 chicken dishes on their menu and she ordered the wrong one for our table. BUT, the manager was great. She fixed the mistake with a smile, gave our friend an extra side and surprised us with a free dessert.

column4: 8 Executive Park Road Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: Wanted to say that the young staff was very accommodating, we had an elderly person (not surprising) and moved to a quieter table with out fanfare!

column4: 71 Lighthouse Road Hilton Head Island, SC  29928
column13: Every week we visit HHI we at least visit Truffles three to four times. That is why we were surprised with our experience. We ordered the BLT Bibb salads. I ordered mine without bacon and with chicken. My wife ordered hears normal. When we started eating them my wife commented that she didn't have bacon and then I noticed I did. We informed the waiter and he stated be didn't know how the kitchen could mix that up. We were extended an apology from the Waiter. I have always taken for granted that the meal we receive was as ordered, I guess I need to double check in the future.

My wife and I absolutely love this restaurant. The food is always great and even with the though the restaurant can get very busy, the servers are (almost) always incredible with it. Although I am unsure it is on the menu, the Holiday Special is my favorite option. A server told me about it some time ago when I asked for something spicy with fresh fish. The dish has fresh Salmon and Tuna with avocados in the middle of the plate with spicy sauce over the top of it all. You will not be disappointed.
Lackluster sushi, decent service. Overpriced for what it is, much better Japanese places in the area.
My wife and I enjoyed a meal at 6:30. We enjoyed the sushi we had ordered and the atmosphere was wonderful. Our server was smiling and seemed excited to be working with us. Thank you.
Enjoyed myself as did the rest of my dining party. I'd definitely return.

GREAT restaurant. From the outside, it doesn't really look like much. But when you walk in , it is just so romantic and intimate. The food was absolutely amazing (including the dessert). Very, very impressed. For me, the prices were a little on the high side but it's the perfect place to dine for a special, romantic occasion. Would love to come back!

column1: Vintage Twelve at Kingston Plantation Resort
column4: 9800 Queensway Blvd. Ste 109 Myrtle Beach, SC  29572
column13: Fairly new restaurant in Kingston Plantation. Food was delicious and presentation was well done. Stunning views of the ocean. Our server was very attentive, answered questions and made suggestions. And just a short walk from our condo!! Will be back!

column4: 1407 Shrimp Boat Lane Mt. Pleasant, SC  29464
column13: We took a spontaneous trip to Charleston. We used Open Table to find a restaurant due to our favorite one was closed. We are very happy to know that we now have a NEW favorite restaurant in Charleston. Our dinners were absolutely wonderful and the appetizer was as well. The location was nice and our seating was perfect. I would like to mention our server by name. His name was Will and if you dine here I suggest you try to be seated in his area. He was nice, prompt, funny, and very knowledgeable of Charleston. We will actually schedule trips to Charleston based on eating here. Its worth our 21/2 hour drive!

column1: WaterScapes Restaurant at the Marina Inn at Grande Dunes
column13: The striped bass was excellent. Service was warm and helpful. We will definitely be back! One of the very best in Myrtle Beach!
We were the only people in the restaurant and it took two hours to get dinner.... a little ridiculous. Food was fine once we got it, but so eerie dining all alone in a large room!
Great food, good service, and wonderful ambiance. Monday night was moderate noise level despite a large number of people.

We went for our 41st anniversary and wanted someplace quiet and good food and service. We were not disappointed. Our waitress Patrice was very accommodating , she made it worthwhile. The food was very good. We are going to return soon. We recommend it to anyone who wants a locally owned, small quiet restaurant to go to. Thanks Patrice.

column4: 8601 S. Antler Dr. North Charleston, SC  29406
column13: Out chef was amazing. With such a large party it was good to see that he was able to keep everyone entertained. Food was cooked to order and the happy birthday song for our daughter was fun.
I had a great time. Food was awesome waiter was funny- Love it

Food was excellent and so if that is your main thing certainly take a trip here. It is expensive for a Sushi bar, starter, 3 types of sashimi and some of the more exotic rolls could easily run a bill up to and perhaps over $50 per person before tip.It is very noisy getting to the point at times that people were almost shouting to be heard.Once the server arrived I will say that he was quite attentive, but there was no real feeling of welcome in entering the restaurant.
We love 300 East! The menu is creative and the food wholesome. We eat there every week.

column4: 127 N Tryon St Entrance at corner 5th St. & Church St. Charlotte, NC  28202
column13: My wife and I ate here for our wedding aniversary. The food was incredible! The bacon pizza is the best I have ever had and my pork chop was cut with a butter knife. My wife's chicken was juicy and well prepared. I would not, however, recommend this place for anyone looking to have a conversation. The tables are very close and the noise level is so loud that romance is out the door. Lots of large groups that were there more for the alcohol rather than the food. I would come again but only if I were with a large party looking to eat and drink the night away.

My husband and I were looking for someplace different to celebrate our anniversary. We thought we would give A Piece of Havana a try. We were pleasantly surprised. From the menu to the people, everything was enjoyable. We can't wait to come back again.

We had a great experience at Amor de Brazil. It was our first time there, and were veryimpressed as we did not know what to expect. Great food, meats were plentiful, and alwaysfresh, great salad bar. Service was very attentive. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!
Food was not quite as good as it has been in the past but will probably return...

column4: 720 Governor Morrison Street Suite 120 Charlotte, NC  28211
column13: Food was very good as usual. However service was slow and uncertain. Three of us had the wine tasting and although the wine was good, we had to remind the server for the second and third glasses. It was like she was unaware that we had more wine coming.
We had my family birthday dinner at Bernardin's. The menu selections were wonderful, something for everyone. The wait staff was attentive and accommodating. We had a lovely evening.

We have started eating Breakfast every Sunday morning before Church at Big View. We try to sit in Kristin's section because she is so lively and has a bubbly. She takes great care of us. The food is irresistible. We have a hard time choosing because everything is so good. We Love Big View Diner.
First time at this place and with a group of 8. Food was excellent

column4: 11318 N Community House Rd Suite 200 Charlotte, NC  28277
column13: Corporate offices are nearby and I had a group in for a meeting from out of town, as am I. They offered a good diverse menu with something for everhyone from small apps that several made dinner out of to full entree meals that were very good, fresh ingredients and well prepared and presented. Service was excellent. We were there on a slow night but assume we would get as good service even if busy. Bar looked nice but I did not spend time there, several in our party who arrived early did and were complimentary to the bar staff and atmosphere.

column4: 110 North College Street The Ritz-Carlton Charlotte Charlotte, NC  28202
column13: Almost there, certainly good. Reviews saying it's bad food are hard to "digest" -- ingredients are very good, and I see a staff with ability through the open kitchen. It's just not excellent. A positive is that a two-some or a dozen can dine there easily. Dress code goes from ties to jeans and a decent shirt. It's not a white-tablecloth Ritz Carlton experience, so that has appeal. There is enough variety on the menu and the wine list (runs from normal vineyards to splurge vineyards, and not 100% California, though few older vintages). Execution is short of excellent, almost very good. Recipes may be a factor: many dishes seem intentionally modified to crowd-pleasing rather than excellence--dumbed down? Service was sincere.
Great spot to dine when going to the Blumenthal for a performance! The attention we received was excellent and the menu choices were bountiful! Everything we ordered was phenomenal!

column4: 14815 Ballantyne Village Way Suite 170 Charlotte, NC  28277
column13: Easily the best Indian food in Charlotte. Also has a surprisingly good wine list.Service was however slow.

column4: 500 S College St Suite 150 Charlotte, NC  28202
column13: My husband and I enjoy Brazilian steakhouses. This made us think of the first steakhouse with a similar name that we went to. It has a very open layout. So there wasn't much privacy from other dinners. The atmosphere is better suited for lunch. The food was good. My husbands only complaint was the low frequency of the meat coming around. Also there wasn't a lot of high end meat. For the price paid he expected more meat. But overall it was a good experience. And it is in an interesting part of the city in the Levine Art Center area.

Very bad experience. Waitress in a hurry and did not take the time to explain the non-typical ordering procedure. Bread was cold and stale. Manager argued with me when I explained my dissatisfaction. Will never go back.

column4: Ashley Park Lane Suite 108 Charlotte, NC  28210
column13: excellent food; attentive service. Well worth re-visiting. Dining area is typical cafe - not intimate but acceptable.

Three of us went there during a conference. Two of us ordered the Vegetable Wrap and they thought they were delicious. I ordered the Vegetarian Couscous. The vegetables were cooked perfectly and the couscous was tender and seasoned delectably. I would certainly return here with friends and family.
The food was great and I will probably go back. We had several servers with there own positions. Our direct waiter was not the best, but I guess for the enviroment that was to be expected.

Our family do not like Mexican food or Hispanic food that much. However, we wanted to give this restaurante a try due to good reviews. our family enjoyed this restaurant from the starts. Waiter was AWESOME. he knew what he was talking about and he knew about the menu. since we didn't know so much about the mexican style food he had to recommend pretty much all of our food. Enjoyed the guacamole appetizer, and all the other foods. Service was great. Food Awesome. we will definitely go back. I will also take my staff since they love mexican as well. It gave me different perspective on typical mexicand food.
No one does guacamole at the table like Cantina! Service was great.

I have always held CG in high regards (we have been here before) but this visit wasn't all that impressive. The wait staff was prof. but no personality and we felt like we were one table in a hundred because she never stayed at our table more than a second. She recommended the most expensive wine right...Didn't even clean the table after courses.

Carpe Diem truly is our favorite restaurant in Charlotte, outshining more expensive competitors. Their decor is intimate and romantic with stunning carved wood elements, and the food is outstanding. We have always found it to be fresh, creative and beautifully presented - and there has not been a time we have dined there when one or both of us didn't spontaneously close our eyes after taking a bite of one of their entrees and say, "Oh my gosh - this is incredible!" My husband and I both agree that although the food is amazing, the service is even better (if that's possible). Each server, as well as the managers, is knowledgeable, attentive and genuinely cares about our dining experience. So thrilled to have found this gem!
Very acceptable. Nothing amazing but consistently good.
Outstanding menu with great choices. Quality across a number of visits has been consistently high. Great dining experience and very reasonably priced.

column1: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House - Charlotte
column13: This was our second visit to Del Friscos, but the first for my wife's son and his girlfriend. We were served by a delightful waiter from Ireland who had only been stateside for a few months. The food was excellent -- fresh bread with butter; a Caesar salad with gigantic croutons; a juicy, tender fillet mignon cooked just right; a crab cake with large chunks of meat (my wife's favorite criticism is "it never slept in the same block with a crab" was definitely not applicable here); family style sides of potatoes, spinach, and mushrooms; and several tempting desserts, including a New Orleans style bread pudding and a creamy cheesecake. This was an early celebration of my wife's birthday, and she later described the evening as "magical".

We found Deltaду»s Charlotte to be a delightful and delicious treat for all five of our senses. The ambiance is of spacious elegance, combining two large well appointed dining areas with a full length bar complete with top shelf libations and a few flat screens for the sports fanatic. The menu boasts the traditional likes of smothered Turkey Wings or Chicken, Catfish Fingers and Black Peas and Rice to your eye opening Cajun Calamari and Fried Gator. You can try everything on your first visitду_. but why? Save some for your next visit and the next and the nextду_ The fast, ever attentive and courteous service will have you thinking of Grandmaду»s during the holidays. Oh and thereду»s LIVE musicду_ Fantastic! We have found our new dining spotду_.Yay!
Perfect place for business lunches. Quiet, and the wait staff is respectful. Elegent, yet not stuffy.
Dressler's gave us a complimentary champagne toast and dessert in honor of our 18th Wedding Anniversary. We had not dined with them before but will definitely dine with them in the future!

column4: 14815 Ballantyne Village Way Suite 240 Charlotte, NC  28277
column13: Loved the wine list and options. Well selected flights.

column4: 16925 Birkdale Commons Pkwy Suite F Huntersville, NC  28078
column13: Staff is friendly and well versed in the menu. Interesting choices and something for everyone! 1/2 price bottle night ROCKS! Server Hannah was super!
Nice hotel restaurant which was just want we wanted. Good food and quiet so we could do some business. The Shrimp and grits were excellent!
Food was fab! Great selection and wonderful cocktail list. Lots of options in and fun environment. Can even get comfy and watch a game in the bar.

We always have a fantastic time when we dine at Fiamma's. Yoshi was our server and made my husband's birthday dinner very special. He was very knowledgable about the wine and the menu. We have come to love this place over the past few months and it's such a treat every time we eat here, they make you feel like family!
Best in Charlotte with tons of local selections!

column4: 8708 J W Clay Blvd Charlotte, NC  28262
column13: Food was good, crying baby made the evening awful-won't go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Located right by Time Warner Cable arena - met friends there before we headed to see the Rush concert - we had a great night.
I have been here multiple times. Took some friends and the loved it. Great food at reasonable price!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Charlotte
column13: This was our first visit, and the food and service were outstanding. The mozzerella and tomato salad was very good, the petite filet was cooked perfectly, and the sea bass over lobster risotta with scallops was outstanding. Our server Gary did a great job. Wonderful experience all around.
Another great meal at Fran's!!! Fantastic menu and not another "chain!" Love it!
this restaurant, inside the ballantyne resort hotel, offers very good food and service.

column4: 4620 Piedmont Row Dr. Suite 110 Charlotte, NC  28210
column13: We originally booked our party for 10 and it ended up being more than 20 - the staff handled it with grace and ease! Thank you!!
Some of the best food I've had in years. Everything was fantastic. Would definitely return and recommend to family and friends.
Fantastic mixologist... creative variable cocktailsA truly new twist on southern cusine
Great service. Warm atmosphere. Consistantly good food. All at a reasonable price.
Enjoyed a wonderful lunch catching up with old friends. A fun, comfortable place!

column4: 2127 Ayrsley Town Blvd Suite 103 Charlotte, NC  28273
column13: We had a wonderful time at Harry's. There are so many things on the menu that we want to try so we will definitely be back.

The food, the service, the presentation were all very good. The menu selection was eclectic and could accommodate all tastes. We sat out doors, it was nice but a bit busy with car traffic near an intersection, but perfect weather to sit outside. We like to share dishes and the server was very accommodating.

Absolutely our favorite experience in the metro area. It's become much more than the outstanding meals we are served when we head to Il Bosco. Service and ambiance are impeccable. Come hungry and save room for exquisite desserts!Ann & John Zientara

column4: 11508 Providence Road, Suite I Charlotte, NC  28277
column13: Love this restaurant. We will definitely go back soon.

column1: Jade Asian Fusion and Sushi Bar
column13: Excellent food! Great atmosphere.

So sorry to see that this restaurant has truly gone downhill. Great meal, then....Waited for over 30 minutes for bill..eventually meal was free, because they could never get the bill out to us, even after consulting with manager and going into the kitchen to find out the problem.
Try the fish and chips, or a burger!

Seven of us were in town for a conference, staying at the Marriott across the street. We selected the King's Kitchen based on the menu selections, positive reviews, and the mission of the non-profit restaurant. We all ordered the skillet fried chicken and thought it was outstanding. The only negative was the noise level, but then since there were 7 of us, I'm sure we contributed to it! Wait staff was very patient and attentive.
The food is always very good at La Paz. Our waiter was excellent!
Great place for a drink, snack, meal with friends or family
This was our first experience. We had a great time and my husband had a great birthday.Thank you

column4: 214 N Tryon Street, Suite 3 Charlotte, NC  28202
column13: The food and service were both excellent. Will definitely dine there again

column4: 601 South Kings Drive Suite AA Charlotte, NC  28204
column13: Mama Ricotta's is consistently wonderful. Great food!

I really like this place. This is the fifth time I dined here. The food is good, the service top notch and not overwhelming and atmosphere is warm and inviting. It's also right next to the South Park mall so you can take a stroll after dinner. We ordered the clam chowder and chopped salad to start. The chowder was excellent and the salad was huge! For our entrees, we chose the tilapia with a side of scampi,the blackened chicken linguine and the shrimp trilogy. All were really good choices. I wish the tilapia dish had a larger piece of fish but it was good and came with these delicious mashed potatoes and veggies. All in all a very good experience and we'll go back.

McCormick & Schmick's Seafood Charlotte was as advertised. While in town for the first time and a convention, my wife and I needed a place to exhale after traveling and before a week of intense scheduled activity. McCormick & Schmick's provided that perfect fit. The service as soon as we arrived was that of "their only customer". Table service - great and not overpowering, great menu, on time delicious meal. It was exactly what we were looking for.
We went here for our anniversary and it was truly special. The food is amazing, the wine list is awesome and the service is great. It is a very private and special atmosphere.

The food was good, but a bit overpriced for what was served. Server took my date's food and disposed of with out asking if she wanted it boxed up to go, she did. 18% gratuity was added for a party of two. Parking validation was not offered. Ambiance was great for a romantic night out.
Lived in Spain and have eaten paella in various places. The ingredients were good and ample. A little soupy for my taste but beat my expectations.

It was convenient being able to book reservations online and I liked that fact that an employee from Nikko called to confirm our reservations as well. I used to live in Charlotte and have eaten at Nikko four to five times before. We drove five hours to have a weekend getaway. I decided to have dinner with friends at Nikko as part of my Halloween weekend fun!!
Steak was cooked perfectly. Was bummed that Hurricane Sandy caused them to run out of tuna (not the restaurant's fault). My wife enjoyed everything as well. Very pleased!

column4: 1000 NC Music Factory Blvd Ste C-10 Charlotte, NC  28206

The only negative comment about this dinning experience was I wish someone would refill my coffee (or asked if I would like to refill it).
Always excellent food and service!
Overall, weighing quality of the food, service, and value, this may be one of the best restaurants in Charlotte.

Wonderful dining experience, the waite staff were patient with us as first time diners with many questions; our waitress was extremely knowledgable about every item on the menu and answered all questions promptly. Our food was served hot and in an appropriate amount of time between courses. My only small disappointment was that I had hope it would be a little quieter prompting a bit more romanticism, as this was a surprise special occasion for my husband I would whole heatedly recommend Passion 8 to anyone up for a fantastic meal.
Not a whole lot of options for vegetarians/pescatarians.

Pewter Rose seems to have everything working well, from ambience to service to a nice variety on the menu. My wife and I both had braised short ribs with root vegetables and an excellent pinot noir. This was her first trip to Pewter Rose, and my first since a lunch several years ago. It immediately jumped to the top of our date night list.

column4: 1100 E Metropolitan Ave Ste 120 Charlotte, NC  28204

was disappointed in the food especially at the price. Service was great, margaritas were good, restaurant was VERY NOISY!

Tucked away in a neighborhood, this local favorite is perfect for a quiet dinner for 2-4 people. It has a great selection of Medterrranean specialties. I had halibut and my date had a veal dish that left us satisfied and ready to return.

column4: 111 Matthews Station Street Mint Hill, NC  28229

Fish and Chips were amazing. Potato cakes were the best I've had! Would highly recommend to anyone looking for an authentic Irish food experience.

column4: 5400 John Q Hammon Drive NW Concord, NC  28027
column13: The service could have been better, the Salmon was great. My Husband had orderd the Pork Sliders which was not great, but they were sliders, so you can't really say much about them, other than the pork was really dry and the rolls were very over cooked. He ended up just takin g the meat off of the roll. We will try to come try it one more time, but it was not the "Wow" we had expected. :/

Went to Rooster's Saturday night while staying in Charlotte. Nice place, great food, great staff and fast, efficient service. Price is in line with other restaurants. It was Opera Night when we went...fantastic fun, so enjoyable and what a deal. Food and opera for $40.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Charlotte Uptown

column4: 130 Harbour Place Dr., Suite 120 Davidson, NC  28036

column1: Savannah Red Restaurant and Wine Bar

The food was excellent as usual. The waitress was inattentive however. there were several times I had to flag down a waitstaff passerby for coffee (coffee refill was served cool not hot had to send back by another waiter)Tiffany , waitress, never checked back on us to see if our steaks were cooked to our liking. Ours were but do not know about our guests.We will return because we love Sullivans. We were very disappointed in the service however from such a high end place.
I've been to Terra several times and have never been disappointed. The food is amazing and the wait staff is extremely knowledgeable. I recommend Terra whenever I can.

column4: 4625 Piedmont Row Drive Suite 105 Charlotte, NC  28210
column13: Caitlyn, our server, clearly enjoys her work and heightened our enjoyment of the occasion.

column4: 14815 Ballantyne Village Way Suite 150 Charlotte, NC  28277
column13: Our party of 6 had a wonderful dining experience on a Sunday night. Three of us had the flounder special which was scrumptious. This is a place we will definitely go back to. Nice that the Ballantyne location takes reservations at night.

Food was great. Waitress was also good. Be careful of the assistant if you turn your head he will take your plate when your half done. We had to stop him twice! It was a busy Saturday night and they wanted to turn the tables. All in all we will go back. Very Very noisey !!

column4: 3909 Providence Rd Suite A Waxhaw, NC  28173
column13: THe food is fantastic at Trattoria Antica. Where we live there are not many good restaurants without a drive to get to them. We are thrilled to have this one close by. Excellent.
There were 6 people in our group and everyone ordered something different. The food was great and so was the service. We will dine here again.

The brunch and service were the best our group found in Charlotte. The feature that was most outstanding was the inclusion of tappas with your brunch. Our waiter brought two three tiered servings to our table, so that we could try them out and make our personal selections.Drinks were prepared and served properly and coffee was fresh and hot.Buffet offered a broad selection for all tastes.

column4: 210 E Trade Street, Suite 104a Charlotte, NC  28202
column13: The only complaint I had that night is that the music was just tooo loud to visit. I understand it was a carrie underwood concert night and everyone was excited, but it was so loud that it was hard to the 4 of us to visit across the table. I don't recall that being the case when we were there two years ago.
Absolutely loved the food as did my friends. Our waiter was lovely and very busy but strived to give us good service and did a nice job. The place was packed, and that was nice.
Party of eight dining early before a play. All enjoyed their food and service was attentive without hovering. Waiter a bit pontifical about menu to suit my preference.
Enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. I had the wild mushroom pizza and the truffle oil was so good! Would prefer the use of real wine glasses, especially when a nice bottle has been ordered.
Perfect in every way!!
Good food but quite expensive compared with other similar restaurants.

column4: 4310 Sharon Road, Ste. W01| Charlotte, NC  28211

Pumpkin bisque is a must try; perfect for the cold, damp Fall weather. The wait staff was attentive but not overly so. Great experience and we will definitely go back! Chef sent sample of butternut squash bisque to table...hope this on the menu the next time we go.

column4: 411 W. Franklin St. Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: Food is unbelievable. Best Italian food in town, by far.

We had a large party that could not be sat at one table. One of the managers went out of his way to find us adjoining booths with the same waitress so that we could order together and have just one bill. The food and service were excellent as always. My favorite is the seafood bisque and fried shrimp.

column4: 518 W. Jones St. West St. Raleigh, NC  27605
column13: Our first time at 518 for brunch. The food was excellent. The shrimp and grits were some of the best I've ever had. My mother in law had a salad topped with grilled salmon and stated the salmon was cooked perfectly. I also appreciate how well the server interacted with our 2-yr old!
Very nice restaurant in the Durham warehouse district. Has charm and appeal.
Great food; wine list isn't very big, but the food is great.

My wife and I ordered two entrees and they were outstanding. One entree was classic steak frites. The beef was a loin cut and cooked perfectly to order; the fries were done just right and were seasoned nicely. The other entree was venison sausage and wild boar over house-made papardelle. What a treat! The servings were more than ample and we ended up taking food home, but we're not complaining :-) I drank a pint of Triangle IPA and, in my opinion, it went better with the entrees than any wine would have. We split a slice of key lime pie for desert. It was also outstanding--very bright with lime juice flavor. I recommend skipping the whipped cream. Noise was better this time because we avoided being up front near the window seating
Beautiful setting; lots of room - tables well spaced. Excellent service

column4: 8411 Brier Creek Pkwy Suite 101 Raleigh, NC  27617
column13: Our third time dining here, and the best so far. Excellent service and wonderful food. Currently the best Indian restaurant in the area.

This was our first visit to Babylon and will definitely visit again. However, even though we told our server numerous times that we were in no rush that night for our entree and wanted some time in between our appetizer and entree, our request was ignored. Having said that we will surely go again but have learned to space out our order ourself. By the way the restaurant was not busy as that would have been an appropriate reason for feeling a little rushed. Please do not hesitate to try this restaurant....we can't wait to share our discovery with friends.

I came here for my birthday with a large party. Claire was our waitress and she was super attentive and knowledgable about the menu. Hand crafted cocktails were delicious. My sisters loved the Marie Claire and my brothers loved the beer selection. Overall, a wonderful dining experience. It was an absolutely wonderful place to celebrate.

column4: 1201 M Raleigh Rd. Chapel Hill, NC  27517
column13: Awesome food and wine to go with top shelf service...all working together!
Our party of 4 had a great time! We had wonderful wine, cocktails and loved all the food we ordered! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about their menu. We'll be going back.

The chef personally came out and talked to my friend on her birthday! Great service- we had requested too spicy of food so the waiter offered to take it back and make it less spicy, overall excellent experience!

Our table of 5 was delighted with our meal. The hot and cold bars held choices for all of us. My sister especially liked the sushi and my mother, who is 92, fell in love with the shrimp bisque. The sweet raspberry dressing was a favorite of mine, adding a tangy topping to the salad. The meats brought to our table were hot, delicious, and plentiful, coming to our table in a timely fashion. Our reservation was for the last lunch seating so we were the only party in the restaurant. We received excellent attention from Benjamin, our server. We could not have asked for a more pleasant dining experience to celebrate my husband's birthday. We will return!!

very costly because we had to order several times to satisfy our appetites large plate is entree size small plate is like a saucer size really was disappointed we were not informed by our waitress. she did know it was our first time there.this was for my birthday and my husband was trying to make it very special...we left disappointed ..food was good but risotto was highly recommended by our waitress and when it arrived we couldn't eat it .. very strong .. the small plate dish of ... can't remember the name it had pulled pork on it pickled onion goat cheese i think was divine wish you offered it in a large plate entree size.
A little noisy for a romantic date, but the food is always excellent!

Dear Sir or Madam, We had brunch after the City of Oaks Half Marathon. There were two kids and six adults. When we walked in, exhausted and cold, the table was already set (with water glasses!!) and our waiter (I think his name was Jeff. It was his last day and he passed us off to someone else at the end, a lovely dark haired woman with a terrific smile) had coffee to us within seconds. The service was excellent, the food was incredible (I had huevos rancheros) and it was a wonderful experience. I have been to Cameron Bar and Grill several times and chose it as our post marathon brunch place. As always, it rose to the occasion! Terrific place, thanks for taking such good care of us!!
We had a table of 10.. Service was good and food was very good and hot. The specials were also special :)

column4: 905 West Main Street - Suite 115 Durham, NC  27701
column13: The food and service here are always amazing!

For a couple of average folks, we were honored like royalty! We are definitely returning!-Brad Smith, La Grange, NC-
We love going to the Chef's Pallet. We even give gift cards to our friends from there. Always a good choice if you are looking for a special meal outside of the chain restaurants.

column4: 308 West Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27516

Our waiter tried hard to compensate, and the bread and delicious dip did a great deal to keep us from gnawing on him or the table....will try again under less stressful conditions.

Food was very good. We had a group of 8.Prices were very reasonable

Very good food for a sports bar.

column4: 454 W. Franklin St Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: Very much enjoyed it overall. Service was very attentive. I thought the menu was interesting, but most of our food (she crab soup, grilled shrimp, sturgeon) was good, but not "WOW!". I don't mind a high bill if food, service, and environment are commensurate, but for our particular selections, I think the menu is overpriced. I'd be willing to give it another chance.
If you are looking for a place that has it all - atmosphere, food and service - this is it.

The food at Troy Mezza is always better than expected. Although not food I would eat every day, it is unique and a great break from the "standard fare". The wine list is good and has a great mix of affordable wines. The friends we dined with had never been to Mezza before and were a bit apprehensive at first but both really enjoyed both the food and the ambiance.
service a little slow at times but otherwise very enjoyable; also gluten-free friendly
Food average plus. Portions modest. VERY noisy. Very busy on a Sunday. Service average. Adequate, but nothing above the ordinary.
Excellence from amuse bouche to espresso. We tried the chef's tasting menu for a special celebration and every course was a delight.

We are a Navy football family and ate here back in 2010. It was a great dining experience then and on our short list for any visit to Greenville. Our 2012 dining experience was equally enjoyable and I would recommend Finnelli's without hesitation. Everyone was very friendly....even the Pirate fans! Go Navy Go Pirates.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Raleigh
